intro: Polygala hayesii, commonly known as Hayes' milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae, which includes over 700 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and open woodlands. Polygala hayesii is often found in areas with well-drained soils and is adapted to survive in dry climates with limited water availability.
